intro: Schoutenia glomerata subsp. peregrina, commonly known as the peregrina schoutenia, is a member of the Malvaceae family. It is a shrub or small tree native to South America, particularly found in regions of Brazil and Peru. The plant is characterized by its palmate leaves and produces clusters of small, white flowers. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often in moist, well-drained soils. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
